simmer.translation[0].definitions[0].def: to boil gently, or to cook something slowly by boiling it gently
simmer.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: Bring the soup to the boil and allow it to simmer gently for about half an hour.
simmer.translation[0].definitions[1].def: if you are simmering with anger, or if anger is simmering in you, you feel very angry but do not show your feelings
simmer.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: He was left simmering with rage.
simmer.translation[0].definitions[2].def: if an argument is simmering, people feel angry with each other but only show it slightly
simmer.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: The row has been simmering for some time.
Violent revolt was simmering in the country.
simmer.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: Bring the vegetables to a simmer.
